name: Sundubu Jjigae (Uncurdled Tofu Stew)
author: shee0089
summary: This is a staple soup that is eaten very often in Korea. This was a winter favorite for me when I lived there.
ingredients: 5 small oyster mushrooms, stemmed, or to taste
1  spring onion, sliced on the diagonal
directions: Place clams in a bowl with lightly salted water to cover
Place kelp in a separate bowl with 1 1/3 cups water
Let clams and kelp soak for 30 minutes
Drain, reserving only the kelp water
Cut off and discard the bottom 1 1/2 inches (roots) of the enoki mushrooms
Heat olive oil, chili powder, and garlic in a pot over medium heat
Stir in the clams, kelp water, and tofu
Add enoki mushrooms, oyster mushrooms, soy sauce, and salt; bring to a boil
Add spring onion, black pepper, and sesame oil
Cook until flavors are intensified, 3 to 6 minutes more
